title: Senior Process Engineer Job at Hobark International Limited
content:
Hobark International Limited (HIL) is the parent company of the Hobark group operating in the oil and gas industry. The company was incorporated in 1998, starting as a staffing agency based in Port Harcourt. Currently we have offices in 4 countries with our head office in Lagos.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Process Engineer

Job Location: Lagos, Nigeria
Job type: Contract
Start Date: 24th July, 2025.

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Perform process optimization studies and recommend solutions to optimize existing installations.
	Support Offshore Operations and SMART Room with flow assurance, process trouble shooting and production optimization activities.
	Recommend facility and / or equipment modification and optimization work programs and prepare the corresponding Scope of Requirements (i.e., Feasibility, Pre-project studies or SMRs).
	Participate in developing safety-related modifications to facilities and corresponding engineering documents (P&IDs, ESD and Fire and Gas logic Diagrams, Flare radiation and capacity, PSVs, HIPS, ...)


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a B.Eng Degree in Chemical Engineering (or equivalent).
	Professional experience: 6+ years of process engineering studies, including site operations exposure.
	Required skills: familiar with the use of process simulation tools such as HYSIS; ProII; OLGA; Flaresim

title: Key Account Executive Job at Hobark International Limited
content:
Hobark International Limited (HIL) is the parent company of the Hobark Group operating in the Oil and Gas Industry. Incorporated in 1998, the company started out as a staffing agency which supplied skilled personnel to the Oil and Gas Industry within Nigeria.

Growth and expansion led to diversification in a variety of services and the construction of offices in Port-Harcourt (Nigeria), Benin (Nigeria), Lagos (Nigeria), Houston (USA), London (UK), Calgary (Canada), Abidjan (Cote D’Ivoire), Libreville (Gabon) and Pointe-Noire (Congo). The corporate headquarters is located in Victoria Island, Lagos (Nigeria).

The subsidiaries that make up the Hobark Group offer a broad spectrum of services and expertise, and together offer Integrated Oilfield Solutions.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Key Account Executive

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Sector: Oil and Gas

Responsibilties
Main Tasks include:


	Acquire a thorough understanding of the customers’ business, goals, needs and requirements.
	Effectively coordinate and track all activities for each assigned account, from lead identification and tender generation through to final payment and account cycle closure.
	Arrange weekly visits to each client to enhance relationships, identify opportunities and address queries and complaints.
	Keep abreast of client production rates, investments and divestments, and other activities, news, and projects in order to build an opportunity pipeline, identify new areas of interest, and generate new business.
	Ensure successful and timely delivery of products and services to assigned accounts according to their specifications.
	Follow up on market activity and develop a thorough understanding of major / competitors in the industry for both supply and services.
	Ensure Client visits are pre-planned and well-prepared prior to the visit.
	Visits are to be made with timely & professional visit reports.
	Prepare regular progress reports for internal and external stakeholders using key account metrics.


Job Specification


	Educational background: BSc / B.Tech Degree in Engineering or Business Administration


Professional experience and requirements:


	Minimum of 5 years of sales experience in a related field / industry., preferably in Oil and Gas related field
	Experience and knowledge in any of the following products is a plus;
	
		Rotating Equipment (pumps, compressor, turbine, and gear
		Valves and actuators
		Gas Detectors
		Hydraulic & Air filtration system.
	
	
	The Job requires frequent traveling within the country.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: obeten_mbang@hobarkintl.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note
Experience and knowledge in any of the following products within the Oil and Gas sector is highly required:


	Rotating Equipment (pumps, compressor, turbine, and gear
	Valves and actuators
	Gas Detectors
	Hydraulic& Air filtration system.

title: B2B Sales Executive Job at Ascentech Services Limited
content:
Ascentech Services Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in 2013 with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: B2B Sales Executive

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Kitchen Appliances / Electronics

Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for experienced and motivated B2B Sales Executives to strengthen our sales team.
	This role focuses on building and expanding our client base across wholesale, distribution, and institutional segments. Candidates with a solid background in the small and kitchen appliances industry will be especially well-positioned for success.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and manage B2B sales pipelines with a focus on wholesale, retail partners, dealers, and institutional buyers.
	Build strong, long-term relationships with key decision-makers and procurement teams.
	Meet and exceed monthly and quarterly sales targets.
	Collaborate closely with the marketing, logistics, and product teams to align strategies and ensure customer satisfaction.
	Conduct regular market analysis to identify new business opportunities and emerging trends.
	Present product offerings effectively to potential clients and negotiate deals.
	Prepare detailed reports and sales forecasts.


Requirements


	Minimum of 3 years of proven experience in B2B sales, preferably within the consumer electronics or home/kitchen appliances sector.
	Strong understanding of product distribution, pricing strategies, and trade relationships.
	Candidates with prior exposure to well-known and established brands in the appliance industry will have a competitive advantage.
	Excellent negotiation, communication, and presentation skills.


Salary
N300,000 - N500,000 / month. 

What We Offer:


	Competitive salary and commission structure.
	Career advancement opportunities within a fast-paced organization.
	Supportive team culture with a focus on professional growth.
	Access to high-demand, market-relevant product lines.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: cv@ascentech.com.ng using “B2B SALES EXECUTIVE - LAGOS” as the subject of the email.

title: Human Resources Manager Job at Blue Wave New Energy Technology Nigeria Company Limited
keyword: blue wave new energy technology nigeria company limited
content:
Blue Wave New Energy Technology Nigeria Company Limited is an innovative new energy company headquartered in Nigeria, committed to providing economical and sustainable power energy solutions to the African continent. The company was founded in 2023 and is headquartered in Lagos, with R&D and manufacturing centres in Jiangxi, China.

With cost-effective products and innovative business models, Blue Wave New Energy is committed to contributing clean and reliable power energy to Africa's progress and prosperity. Its product lines cover solar lighting systems, portable energy storage equipment, home-integrated energy storage systems, and outdoor mobile power platforms to meet customers' power needs in multiple scenarios.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Manager
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Renewable Energy (Solar, Storage, Wind)

Job Summary


	We’re hiring an HR Manager to lead and scale our HR function in a growing renewable energy startup.
	This role is ideal for someone with experience building HR systems from scratch and working in Chinese-led organizations.
	You’ll work closely with leadership to drive people strategy, talent acquisition, compliance, performance, and culture.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute HR strategy aligned with company growth.
	Oversee end-to-end recruitment and workforce planning.
	Build performance management, L&D, and employee engagement frameworks.
	Manage compensation, benefits, and attendance tracking systems.
	Foster a collaborative culture and bridge cross-cultural team dynamics.
	Ensure compliance with Nigerian labor laws and internal policies.


Key Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in HRM, Business Admin, or related field.
	Minimum 6 years of HR experience, with 2+ years in management.
	CIPM or CIPD certification is required.
	Proven record building HR systems in startups.
	Experience working with Chinese expatriate leadership is strongly preferred.
	Solid knowledge of Nigerian labor laws and HR best practices.


Salary
N350,000 - N400,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@bluewave.top using "HR Manager - Renewable Energy' as the subject of the email.
